name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump’s return to the White House threatens to further an outbreak of his own making. Then: Should you throw away all traces of your ex? In a new “Dear Therapist,” Lori Gottlieb weighs in. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/innJLdXI45

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A lot of people like to gaze upon images that evoke the 'unity of thought and action.' A lot of people like displays of pageantry, military force, and power," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/62UpFAZkDn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sean Conley, the president's doctor, is trained in osteopathy—a uniquely American tradition that began with a midwestern healer disillusioned with mainstream medicine, @elliepses writes: https://t.co/IwwaoGEJFc

name: TheAtlantic
text: The French molecular biologist Jacques Monod saw chance as one of the “secrets of life,” writes @SeanBiolCarroll, an idea he used to tear down political and religious dogmas. https://t.co/i8aLnuDPSW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Pessimism is irresponsible. Nihilism is immoral. Here’s what you can do to protect our democracy from now until November 3 and beyond," @AnneApplebaum writes: https://t.co/J1pl04lDvH

name: TheAtlantic
text: The tax code "needs to be simple enough for lower-income families to understand and benefit from, and simple enough to make high-income families comply and pay up," argues @AnnieLowrey: https://t.co/uEFq3dy36I

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some Britney Spears fans are convinced that the pop star is being controlled by her father. @skornhaber reports on their "Free Britney" movement and whether it's doing more harm than good. https://t.co/8U9uvbjUCa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the weekend, floodwater from a heavy storm destroyed buildings, bridges, and roads in a mountainous region of southeastern France. So far, at least 12 deaths have been reported, and 20 people remain missing. Via @theAtlPhoto: https://t.co/A6r3klz5fZ https://t.co/48b5wT45SM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Since reopening in August, American movie theaters have only offered audiences one big-budget blockbuster. Without another, they’re doomed, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/BtQUkRdVVS

name: TheAtlantic
text: There’s a chance the nation will wake up November 4 to at least one hopeful sign about the health of its democracy: A record number of citizens will have voted, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/my5xXrdUdF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Since the president tweeted that he has COVID-19, his replies have been full of strange hexes. This bizarre display is just another example of how the whole internet has been taken over by pop-music stans, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/mlW7IX82ei

name: TheAtlantic
text: Long before Kamala Harris became a national figure, India played a role in American politics, @DinyarPatel writes: https://t.co/JBW3NMysof

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Republican judges are serious about using their power to obstruct Democrats in office, even when doing so is legally indefensible and blatantly undemocratic—indeed, even when it jeopardizes human life," @nicholas_bagley writes: https://t.co/8U9fzlDrb3

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: Today’s charges against a pair of alleged ISIS killers, writes @gcaw, are what their victims' families wanted: https://t.co/yffqfDO0R7

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: "Networks of fan accounts have been so coordinated for so long that they can make something a trend without trying—even a fake curse in an arbitrarily chosen foreign language."

It's another day on the internet with @kait_tiffany: 

https://t.co/5lL5nmf2a3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The vice-presidential debate will be, in effect, a debate between the Republican past and the Democratic future," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/YJEtR6FDRm

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @danteramos: As @DrRitaColwell notes, "the urgent, high-profile research that female scientists"—including brand-new Nobelist Jennifer Doudna—"are doing now is also a reminder of how much the sciences have sacrificed by shutting women out in the past." https://t.co/aYcpl2PrZD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "These court decisions have limited the ability of the people to hold their representatives accountable through direct democracy," @davedaley3 writes: https://t.co/Js7pRJksK5

name: TheAtlantic
text: The South Carolina Senate race is now being called a toss-up. Last spring, @adamhsays profiled Jaime Harrison, the rising candidate trying to unseat Lindsey Graham and become the first South Carolina Democrat to win a statewide election in 14 years: https://t.co/1Rvy3yezKx

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Even as Kamala Harris sought a job that has been defined by its lack of power,” @megangarber writes, “people found ways to complain that she was seeking too much power.” https://t.co/zrDTHW63fz
